title: Shyvana is now a reminder to the enemy team to ward dragon...
body:
And I said it would be the one problem when I first saw her new passive was dragon reliant.

Literally this every single game -.- "All I gotta do is gank bot and ward dragon and Shyvana has no passive lol."

The new passive is not only a nerf to mid and late game tankiness overall, but now picking Shyvana is nothing more than a reminder to the enemy team that dragon is an objective. Meanwhile your team couldn't care less still...

And before you say her new passive is to compensate power in other areas. It doesn't. Her win rate has plummeted and aside from that all the other abilities already were self compensated for their changes.

W: Lost flame trail gained size.
E: Lost human form power gained dragon form power.
R: Lost 100 range and double MR/Armor from passive and damage, gained unstoppable and a tiny chunk of HP

The passive nerf, because that is what it is, wasn't needed. Her new passive is a joke, but after all, everyone complained the old one was 'not interactive', you all got just what you wanted. GJ.

I already knew this was gonna be the case. Being balanced around a situational passive is stupid. It's thematic and cool, but there's nothing really rewarding about it.

I hated it, because I knew they would cut down on power else where causing her team fight presence to be completely situational as to whether or not you can secure dragons. It's not like Kindreds passive where Jungle monsters are always available in the enemy's jungle at some point in the game, or Rengar's on how he has to slay champions or gain assists, rather there are only a handful of dragons to secure each game and they can be easily denied by vigilant team.

So would you say you mostly like the overall direction, aside from the passive, which is too much of a nerf?

If so, do you think it would be possible to keep the current direction of the passive without it feeling like a 'nerf' (i.e. maybe it's just a little undertuned)?

The kit itself is fine. The passive is just a more conditional version of her boring old passive. But with Shyvana's passive the problem is, every passive you could give to Shyvana belongs to somebody else already.

Bleed! She is a savage Dragon! Oh... Darius...

Burning! She is a Dragon! Oh... Brand...

Attack speed from taking damage! Because she is swift and savage! Oh... Olaf and Jax...
Hybrid Shred! Since she deals hybrid damage! Oh... Kayle...
HP regen from killing things! Because Dragon! Oh... Cho'Gath...
Conditional Tenacity! To help her be an unstoppable Dragon! Oh... Irelia...
Gains defensive stats that stack by dealing damage! Oh... Sejauni...
A last breath type HP regen effect! Oh... Volibear...
An epic cheat death because of bloodlust and fury effect! Oh... Aatrox...

Like, what do you give a furious, mighty, swift and savage half dragon, that isn't already taken...
Well from reading this, I encourage you to develop a unique passive that no champions currently has that would fit Shyvana's theme. I'm looking forward to your thoughts.

#Fury of the Dragonborn:

_**Effects:**_

 * When at full rage bar Shyvana gets 25% slow reduction and 1/1.25/1.5% of her **MISSING** HP as TRUE DMG on hit
 * When Shyvana enters dragon form the slow reduction is increased to 50% and the bonus missing HP TRUE DMG is 2/2.5/3%
 * When Shyvana leaves dragon form she loses her passive until her rage bar is full again. 
 * When Shyvana slays a dragon she will bathe in their blood and absorb their power to harden her own scales => 
+5 Armor & MR bonus when entering her **dragon ** form for each dragon slain. 
 

# Now before you start shouting "Omg this is OP/UP"  look at the math:

>Passive notes:
 >
 * Shyvana now has rage bar from level 1 (so she has passive access pre 6)
 * After leaving combat for 10sec Shyvanas rage bar starts deteriorating by 2 fury per sec. 
(60 sec to go empty after not doing/taking damage)
 * Example for on hit TRUE DMG: 
Shyvana has 3000 max HP she is missing 1500 HP => passive does 0.03x1500=45 True DMG on hit (in dragon form for being 50% HP with 3000 max HP)
 * slow reduction functions like {{item:3009}} [swift boots](http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/Boots_of_Swiftness) and http://vignette2.wikia.nocookie.net/leagueoflegends/images/7/7b/Swiftness_mastery_s4.png/revision/latest?cb=20131122000449  [Swiftness mastery](http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/Swiftness_(Season_2016_Mastery) ) but if she gets this item/mastery the bonus is added [multiplicatively](http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/Stacking) and not additively

**Example**
Shyvana has 400 MS she gets hit by a 50% slow which leads to losing 200 MS but thanks to slow resist she gains back:
 [50% of 200 Dragon Passive= 100MS back) + [25% of that **remaining ** 50% = 0.25 x 100=25 MS (12.5%) multiplicative increase from Swifties] + [15% of the remaining 37.5% of the slow with swiftness mastery =>  0.15 x 75 = 11.25MS (5.625%) =>Total of  68.125% (Dragon passive + boots + mastery) => 0.68125 x 200MS (MS lost to slow) = 136.25 MS back 
(has 336 MS instead of 200 MS when hit with 50% slow at 400 MS so she lost only 64 MS.)

So in short, it's mostly a tuning problem combined with a questionable passive (which may, itself, just be a tuning problem). I can agree with that. I've done quite well with her post-rework (in norms, albeit, which are relatively easy), but I do feel her passive needs a bit more oomph. I'm not sure how I feel on it being so objective-oriented (you outlined the problems pretty well!), though there is a flip side: with the bonus damage, nabbing dragons has never been easier.

As for the suggestion that her e needs a slow (from another poster), I don't think that's an altogether terrible idea. That said, I do like that you're forced to play around Shyvana's weaknesses. From masteries (e.g. stormraider's surge), to runes (e.g. movement speed quints), to summoners (e.g. exhaust, ghost), to items (e.g. swifties, deadman's, frozen mallet, chilling smite), you've a lot of options to mitigate her weaknesses. What's more, you're rewarded for holding onto your ultimate to use as a gap closer, rather than necessarily using it as an initiator 100% of the time. Some of that, I think, is a _good_ thing. It rewards smart play and itemizing properly against the enemy comp.

Which is not to say she doesn't need something more in the way of helping her engage. I really dunno. I'm just a lowly silver that plays Shyvana on occasion for fun.

All champions should be put in a position to win and Shyvana hasn't been in that position for a long time.

there is a pretty big difference between how you think a change will effect a champ versus the experience when it actually goes live.

imho the dragon being the source of your ability to tank is stupid, as it allows the enemy to simply focus that objective and knee cap the enemy jungler on top of the advantage it already gives you.

picking shy now means your own team has to be 100% focused on getting dragons or risk their own jungle stalling and being utterly useless late game, making the main focus of the entire game on dragon. that really really sucks for any non-5 man team play.

the removal of the fire trail has effectively removed any sort of disengage she had, you could always chase but the damage from the fire trail was the only thing that discouraged people from sticking to you to chase the kill.

i didnt forsee the fire trail nerf making that big of a difference but i have watched three games now where people didnt chase initially, but quickly realized there was no reason not to anymore and almost always were able to catch up with dashes or CC and then kill me, when previously they would have taken a ton of fire damage doing so and lost the trade when i turned back on them with a fire ball or Q. 

imho the ability to bug out with the old fire trail covering your ass when things got hairy in a team fight was the core of her old kit with out it she is not really worth playing any more. she feels worse than aatrox now
